ingredients: Whole spices (4 cloves, 2 bay leaves, 4 green cardamoms, 1-inch cinnamon stick, 1 black cardamom)
A pinch of saffron soaked in 2 tablespoons warm milk
Water as needed for boiling rice

steps.title: Rinse the Rice
steps.description: Place basmati rice in a bowl and rinse under cold water until the water runs clear to remove excess starch.

steps.title: Soak the Rice
steps.description: Soak the rinsed rice in enough water for 30 minutes to allow it to soften slightly.

steps.title: Boil Water for Rice
steps.description: In a large pot, bring plenty of water to a boil. Add salt and whole spices (cloves, bay leaves, cardamoms, cinnamon, etc.).

steps.title: Parboil the Rice
steps.description: Add soaked rice to boiling water and cook until it's about 70% done (firm but not fully soft). Then drain and set aside.

steps.title: Heat Oil and Ghee
steps.description: In a deep pan, heat the cooking oil and ghee together over medium heat.

steps.title: Fry the Onions
steps.description: Add sliced onions to the hot oil and ghee. Fry until golden brown and crispy. Remove half and set aside for garnish.

steps.title: Add Ginger-Garlic Paste
steps.description: To the remaining onions in the pan, add ginger-garlic paste and saut√© for 1-2 minutes until the raw smell disappears.

steps.title: Add Chicken or Mutton
steps.description: Add the cleaned chicken or mutton pieces to the pan. Cook on medium-high heat until the meat is browned on all sides.

steps.title: Add Chopped Tomatoes
steps.description: Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and blend into the mixture.

steps.title: Add Ground Spices and Salt
steps.description: Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, black pepper, biryani masala, and salt. Cook until the oil begins to separate.

steps.title: Stir in Yogurt
steps.description: Lower the heat and add the plain yogurt. Stir quickly to avoid curdling and cook until the yogurt is well incorporated.

steps.title: Add Dried Plums and Chilies
steps.description: Add dried plums (alu Bukhara) and slit green chilies. Simmer the mixture until the meat becomes tender.

steps.title: Fry the Potatoes
steps.description: In a separate pan, lightly fry the halved potatoes until golden and slightly crisp on the edges.

steps.title: Add Potatoes to Meat
steps.description: Add the fried potatoes to the meat mixture and stir gently to coat them in the masala.

steps.title: Start Layering - First Rice Layer
steps.description: In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, add half of the parboiled rice as the first layer.

steps.title: Add Meat and Potato Layer
steps.description: Spread the entire cooked meat and potato mixture evenly over the rice layer.

steps.title: Top with Remaining Rice
steps.description: Cover the meat layer with the remaining half of the rice.

steps.title: Add Garnish and Aromatics
steps.description: Sprinkle fried onions, chopped coriander, mint leaves, lemon juice, kewra water, rose water (if using), and saffron milk on top.

steps.title: Seal the Pot
steps.description: Cover the pot with a tight lid or seal it with dough to trap the steam (dum).

steps.title: Cook on Dum
steps.description: Place the sealed pot on low heat and cook for 20-25 minutes to allow flavors to meld and rice to finish cooking.

steps.title: Rest Before Serving
steps.description: Let the biryani rest for 5-10 minutes after dum cooking before opening the lid.

steps.title: Mix and Serve
steps.description: Gently fluff the rice and mix slightly to distribute meat and potatoes. Serve hot with raita or salad.
